thread.title: Quick Success in Web and Mobile-Enablement of Logistics and Warehousing Application
thread.title_full: Quick Success in Web and Mobile-Enablement of Logistics and Warehousing Application

author: John Rhodes
title: Quick Success in Web and Mobile-Enablement of Logistics and Warehousing Application
text:
When a global logistics management company wanted to modernize a mission-critical, legacy application, management looked to CM First, a leader in modernization methodologies and software. The existing supply chain management application didn’t scale well to keep up with business demands, wasn’t web or mobile-enabled and required servers and a VPN in every site. “Time was critical to this company,” said John Rhodes, CTO. “While some companies consider a complete rewrite or replacement of the existing application, the management was reluctant to spend the time and money to convert and didn’t feel that the risk was acceptable.”
In four months, the team of CM First developers and only 1-2 developers from the IT department had web-enabled the entire application and installed it in production. CM First’s SAP Crystal Reports integration made a critical difference in deployment. Shortly after, the quick uptake of the web version made it clear that a mobile app would be necessary.
“With the high supply chain volumes, having the mobile option integrated made the company the right partner for customers; the company provided the exact tool needed for their supply chain management and control,” said the company’s business intelligence manager.
Legacy applications can hold a company back from competing in the marketplace. CM First has quick and affordable solutions that can transform a business. Learn more about application modernization with CM First at: http://www.cmfirstgroup.com/initiatives/application-modernization/ If mobile-enablement is a key challenge, look at CM First solutions at: http://www.cmfirstgroup.com/initiatives/mobile-application-enablement/
Read the full case study at: http://www.cmfirstgroup.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/logistics-management-company-achieves-web-and-mobile-success.pdf
About CM First Group
CM First is a global software and services company established in 1999 with a focus on modernizing applications, managing technical debt and the agile development of enterprise apps. Delivery areas include; migrations of software code, databases and IBM hardware, custom app, architecture and API development, mobility solutions and knowledge transfer. CM First works with hundreds of IBM and CA Technologies business-critical systems worldwide, with numerous reference customers covering industries as diverse as logistics, travel, insurance, food processing and oil and gas construction.
